name: Techno
description: Highly beat-driven, repetitive, and mechanical, typically featuring minimal chord variation and melodies, focuses on rhythms and timbral variety; generally produced for club environments.

children.name: Acid Techno
children.description: Incorporates "squelching" synths from Acid House into a mechanical and usually more energetic Techno context.

children.name: Acid Techno
children.description: Incorporates "squelching" synths from Acid House into a mechanical and usually more energetic Techno context.

children.name: Ambient Techno
children.description: Blends the mechanical, repetitive beats of Techno with atmospheres and textures inspired by Ambient music, resulting in slower tempos and more understated rhythms.

children.name: Ambient Techno
children.description: Blends the mechanical, repetitive beats of Techno with atmospheres and textures inspired by Ambient music, resulting in slower tempos and more understated rhythms.

children.name: Belgian Techno
children.description: Early form of Hardcore [EDM], resulting from the further evolution of New Beat due to the strong influence of Techno and EBM.

children.name: Belgian Techno
children.description: Early form of Hardcore [EDM], resulting from the further evolution of New Beat due to the strong influence of Techno and EBM.

children.name: Bleep Techno
children.description: Established in the late 1980s in the breakdancing and early rave scene of Yorkshire in the North of England, notable for its "bleepy" synth lines and heavy sub-bass.

children.name: Bleep Techno
children.description: Established in the late 1980s in the breakdancing and early rave scene of Yorkshire in the North of England, notable for its "bleepy" synth lines and heavy sub-bass.

children.name: Detroit Techno
children.description: Features a signature mechanical, detached sound that echoed the atmosphere of Detroit's nightlife and incorporated influences from Electro, Chicago House, as well as Synthpop and Electro-Disco.

children.name: Detroit Techno
children.description: Features a signature mechanical, detached sound that echoed the atmosphere of Detroit's nightlife and incorporated influences from Electro, Chicago House, as well as Synthpop and Electro-Disco.

children.name: Freetekno
children.description: Originated in the early 1990s, commonly played at free parties in Europe, and features a repetitive pounding kick drum at tempos of 170 BPM or above.

children.name: Freetekno
children.description: Originated in the early 1990s, commonly played at free parties in Europe, and features a repetitive pounding kick drum at tempos of 170 BPM or above.

children.name: Hard Techno
children.description: Typically rave-oriented form characterized by hard, prominent kick drums, pounding rhythms, fast tempos around 140-160 BPM, and aggressive, often distorted sounds.

children.name: Hard Techno
children.description: Typically rave-oriented form characterized by hard, prominent kick drums, pounding rhythms, fast tempos around 140-160 BPM, and aggressive, often distorted sounds.

children.name: Hardgroove Techno
children.description: Features shuffling grooves with heavy emphasis on layered percussive elements; often includes a mix of samples and drum machines played at a range of 135-140 BPM.

children.name: Hardgroove Techno
children.description: Features shuffling grooves with heavy emphasis on layered percussive elements; often includes a mix of samples and drum machines played at a range of 135-140 BPM.

children.name: Industrial Techno
children.description: Harder, darker style of Techno which draws parallels with factories and the rhythm of machinery.

children.name: Industrial Techno
children.description: Harder, darker style of Techno which draws parallels with factories and the rhythm of machinery.

children.name: Melodic Techno
children.description: Trance-influenced subgenre that was established in the mid-to-late 2010s, characterized by gradually progressing structure, and hypnotizing, atmospheric sound with arpeggiated, minor melodies, playing at around 120-125 BPM.

children.name: Melodic Techno
children.description: Trance-influenced subgenre that was established in the mid-to-late 2010s, characterized by gradually progressing structure, and hypnotizing, atmospheric sound with arpeggiated, minor melodies, playing at around 120-125 BPM.

children.name: Minimal Techno
children.description: Stripped-down and sparse, often featuring a dark sound and a slow, steady development through the track.

children.name: Minimal Techno
children.description: Stripped-down and sparse, often featuring a dark sound and a slow, steady development through the track.

children.name: Peak Time Techno
children.description: Hard, dynamic, energetic and accessible subgenre featuring strong kicks, massive dirty synths, tempos around 130 BPM, more suspenseful structures with breaks and build-ups, and big, modern, festival-oriented sound; rose to high popularity in the late 2010s.

children.name: Peak Time Techno
children.description: Hard, dynamic, energetic and accessible subgenre featuring strong kicks, massive dirty synths, tempos around 130 BPM, more suspenseful structures with breaks and build-ups, and big, modern, festival-oriented sound; rose to high popularity in the late 2010s.

children.name: Wonky Techno
children.description: Strays from the standard beat of Techno, opting for a more fractured sound.

children.name: Wonky Techno
children.description: Strays from the standard beat of Techno, opting for a more fractured sound.
